Created attachment 35556
Conf and Wireshark file

There's a problem when you have a virtual host proxy who uses the ssl engine and is set to only use TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2 and you try to connect with a client who only uses TLSv1.0 with a TLSv1 Layer. When the client is trying to connect to the server, the server is closing the connection but is not sending a TLS Alert. 

I will attach the used configuration for that part and a wireshark record.

The problem is also occuring on linux openSUSE.

Tested with curl (7.55.1 (x86_64-w64-mingw32) libcurl/7.55.1 OpenSSL/1.0.2l zlib/1.2.11 libidn2/2.0.4 libssh2/1.8.0 nghttp2/1.23.1) and command "curl --tlsv1.0 --insecure <address>"
creator: michael.nguyen@bertelsmann.de
michael.nguyen@bertelsmann.de
text:
Hey,

i'm sorry for this bug report.

The issue lies in the OpenSSL version 1.0.2l. If you use 1.1.0g it will respond with a TLS-Alert.

Regards,
Michael
